result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J Natalizio

records.addlTxt:
File not called on the record. 
9:32 AM Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Nicholas J Natalizio. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defense requests a date in about 12 weeks for the Defendant to complete batterer's intervention course. State does not object, and indicates that case will be dismisses upon completion of course. Clerk sets.
Hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Nicholas J Natalizio in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Nicholas J Natalizio.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense was just appointed by the PD's office (PD order still needs to be filed). 
State sent pre-trial offer.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Nicholas J Natalizio in court. 

Defendant is working on retaining private counsel  Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:28 AM Defendant Nicholas J Natalizio in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 15th, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
